style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Section 2 - FINANCIAL INFORMATION</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:96px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 2.02 </span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Results of Operations and Financial Condition.</span></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">February&#160;4, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, Gilead Sciences, Inc., a Delaware corporation (Gilead), issued a press release announcing its financial results for the quarter and year ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. A copy of the press release is filed as </span><a style="text-decoration:underline;color:#0000FF;-sec-extract:exhibit;" href="exhibit991earningspres.htm"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Exhibit 99.1</span></a><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to this report. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Gilead has presented certain financial information in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) and also on a non-GAAP basis. Management believes this non-GAAP information is useful for investors, when considered in conjunction with Gilead&#8217;s GAAP financial statements, because management uses such information internally for its operating, budgeting and financial planning purposes. Non-GAAP information is not prepared under a comprehensive set of accounting rules and should only be used to supplement an understanding of Gilead&#8217;s operating results as reported under GAAP. Non-GAAP measures may be defined and calculated differently by other companies in the same industry.  A reconciliation between GAAP and non-GAAP financial information is provided in the tables on pages 9, 10, 11 and 12 of the press release filed as Exhibit 99.1 to this report.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The information in this Form 8-K and the exhibit attached hereto shall not be deemed &#8220;filed&#8221; for purposes of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act), or otherwise subject to the liabilities under that section, nor shall it be deemed incorporated by reference in any filing under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act, regardless of any general incorporation language in such filing.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Section 9 - FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND EXHIBITS</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 9.01</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Financial Statements and Exhibits.</span></div><div Sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$5.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;-</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">- Full Year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Product Sales of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$22.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;-</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">- Full Year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Diluted EPS of </font><font -</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">- Full Year </font><font of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">$6.63</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;per share -</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Foster City, CA, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">February&#160;4, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;- Gilead Sciences, Inc. (Nasdaq: GILD) announced today its results of operations for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and full year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. Total revenues for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$5.9 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$5.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the same period in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. Net income for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.12</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;per diluted share, compared to net income of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$3 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$0.00</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;per diluted share, for the same period in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. Non-GAAP net income for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$1.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$1.30</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;per diluted share, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$1.9 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$1.44</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;per diluted share, for the same period in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Full year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;total revenues were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$22.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$22.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. Net income for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$5.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$4.22</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;per diluted share, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$5.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$4.17</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;per diluted share, for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. Non-GAAP net income for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$8.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$6.63</font><font style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font intangible assets acquired in connection with the acquisition of Kite Pharma, Inc. (Kite) and pre-tax write-downs of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$500 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$410 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, respectively, for slow moving and excess raw material and work in process inventory.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">In addition to the factors noted above, the full year 2019, compared to the same period in 2018, was impacted by pre-tax up-front collaboration and licensing expenses of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$3.92 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;related to Gilead&#8217;s global research and development collaboration agreement with Galapagos NV (Galapagos) in 2019.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">The following tables summarize significant items Product sales for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$4.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in the United States, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$840 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in Europe and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$440 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in other locations. Product sales for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter of 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$4.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in the United States, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$813 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in Europe and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$398 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in other locations.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Total product sales in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$22.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$21.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. For </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, product sales were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$16.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in the United States, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$3.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in Europe and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.0 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in other locations. For </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, product sales were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$16.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in the United States, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$3.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in Europe and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$1.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in other locations.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$4.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the same period in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. For </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, HIV product sales were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$16.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$14.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. The increases were primarily driven by higher sales volume as a result of the continued uptake of Biktarvy</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;(bictegravir 50 mg/emtricitabine 200 mg/tenofovir alafenamide 25 mg).</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:5px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) product sales</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$630 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$738 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the same period in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. For </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, HCV product sales were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.9 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$3.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. The declines were primarily due to lower average net selling price.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:5px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Yescarta</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;(axicabtagene ciloleucel) generated </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$122 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in sales during the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$81 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. For </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Yescarta sales were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$456 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$264 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. The increases were driven by a higher number of therapies provided to patients and the continued expansion in Europe.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" During the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">fourth quarter of 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Gilead recorded write-downs of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$500 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$410 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, respectively, for slow moving and excess raw material and work in process inventory primarily due to lower long-term demand for Gilead&#8217;s HCV products.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:5px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">R&amp;D expenses increased primarily due to up-front collaboration and licensing expenses of&#160;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$3.92 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#160;related to Gilead&#8217;s global research and development collaboration agreement with Galapagos, partially offset by lower stock-based compensation expense associated with Gilead&#8217;s acquisition of Kite. Furthermore, R&amp;D expenses and non-GAAP R&amp;D expenses&#160;increased&#160;primarily due to higher personnel costs to support Gilead&#8217;s cell therapy business.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:5px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">SG&amp;A expenses increased primarily due to promotional expenses in the United States and expenses associated with the expansion of Gilead&#8217;s business in Japan and China, partially offset by lower stock-based compensation expense associated with Gilead&#8217;s acquisition of Kite.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:5px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Non-GAAP SG&amp;A increased primarily due to promotional expenses in the United States and expenses associated with the expansion of Gilead&#8217;s business in Japan and China.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Cash, Cash Equivalents and Marketable Debt Securities</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:14px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">December 31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Gilead had </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$25.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of cash, cash equivalents and marketable debt securities compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$31.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;as of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">December 31, 2018</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. During </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Gilead generated </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$9.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in operating cash flow, paid </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$5.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in connection with the global research and development collaboration agreement with Galapagos and equity investments in Galapagos, repaid </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of principal amount of debt, paid cash dividends of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$3.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and utilized </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$1.7 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on stock repurchases.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- more -</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:18pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:18pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.609375%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:34%;"></td><td style="width:33%;"></td><td style="width:33%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">February 4, 2020</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">5</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Full Year</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Guidance</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:14px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Gilead provides its full year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;guidance below. Starting in 2020, Gilead will no longer regularly exclude stock-based compensation expense from its non-GAAP financial information. For comparability purposes, full year 2019 non-GAAP operating income and non-GAAP diluted earnings per share would have been </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$10.4 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$6.13</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, respectively, had stock-based compensation expense not been excluded.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:4px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Topline results from the Phase 2 ATLAS study of combination and monotherapy investigational treatments in patients with bridging fibrosis (F3) and compensated cirrhosis (F4) due to nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font NASH.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td study treatment in Gilead&#8217;s NASH clinical program. </font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Non-GAAP Financial Information</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font as non-GAAP. Management believes non-GAAP information is useful for investors, when considered in conjunction with Gilead&#8217;s GAAP financial information, because management uses such information internally for its operating, budgeting and financial planning purposes. Non-GAAP information is not prepared under a comprehensive set of accounting rules and should only be used to supplement an understanding of Gilead&#8217;s operating results as reported under GAAP. Non-GAAP measures may be defined and calculated differently by other companies in the same industry. A reconciliation between GAAP and non-GAAP financial information is provided in the tables on pages 9 through 12.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Conference Call</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">At 4:30 p.m. Eastern Time today, Gilead&#8217;s management will host a conference call and a simultaneous webcast to discuss the company&#8217;s fourth quarter&#160;and full year 2019&#160;financial results and provide a business update. The live webcast of the call can be accessed at Gilead&#8217;s Investors page at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;color:#0000ff;text-decoration:underline;">http://investors.gilead.com</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. Please connect to the website at least 15 minutes prior to the start of the call to allow adequate time for any software download that may be required to listen to the webcast. Alternatively, please call 877-359-9508 (U.S.) or 224-357-2393 (international) and dial the conference ID 9634129 to access the call. Telephone replay will be available approximately two hours after the call through 8:00 p.m. Eastern Time, February 6, 2020. To access the replay, please call 855-859-2056 (U.S.) or 404-537-3406 (international) and dial the conference ID 9634129. style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">About Gilead Sciences</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;color:#828282;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Gilead Sciences, Inc. is a research-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, develops and commercializes innovative medicines in areas of unmet medical need. The company strives to transform and simplify care for people with life-threatening illnesses around the world. Gilead has operations in more than </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">35</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;countries worldwide, with headquarters in Foster City, California.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Forward-looking Statements</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Statements included in this press release that are not historical in nature are forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Gilead cautions readers that forward-looking statements are subject to certain risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially. These risks and uncertainties include: Gilead&#8217;s ability to achieve its anticipated full year 2020 financial results; Gilead&#8217;s ability to accelerate or sustain revenues for its antiviral and other programs; Gilead&#8217;s ability to realize the potential benefits of collaborations or licensing arrangements, including those with The Rockefeller University, Kyverna Therapeutics, Inc., Eisai Co., Ltd., Kiniksa Pharmaceuticals, Ltd. and Glympse Bio, Inc.; Gilead&#8217;s ability to initiate clinical trials in its currently anticipated timeframes; the risk that safety and efficacy data from clinical studies may not warrant further development of Gilead&#8217;s product candidates, including Yescarta in combination with mavrilimumab, 3BNC117, 10-1074, GS-6207 and product candidates evaluated for bridging fibrosis and compensated cirrhosis due to NASH; Gilead&#8217;s ability to submit new drug applications for new product candidates in the timelines currently anticipated; Gilead&#8217;s ability to receive regulatory approvals in a timely manner or at all, for new and current products, including FDA and MHLW approvals for filgotinib for the treatment of RA and FDA and European Commission approvals of KTE-X19 for the treatment of mantle cell lymphoma; Gilead&#8217;s ability to successfully commercialize its products, including expansion in China; the risk that private and public payers may be reluctant to provide, or continue to provide, coverage or reimbursement for new products; a larger than anticipated shift in payer mix to more highly discounted payer segments; market share and price erosion caused by the introduction of generic versions of Gilead products; the risk that physicians and patients may not see advantages of these products over other therapies and may therefore be reluctant to prescribe the products; and other risks identified from time to time in Gilead&#8217;s reports filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC). In addition, Gilead makes estimates and judgments that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses and related disclosures. Gilead bases its estimates on historical experience and on various other market specific and other relevant assumptions that it believes to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources. There may be other factors of which Gilead is not currently aware that may affect matters discussed in the forward-looking statements and may also cause actual results to differ significantly from these estimates. Further, results for the quarter and the year ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">December 31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;are not necessarily indicative of operating results for any future periods. Gilead directs readers to its press releases, Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the quarter ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">September 30, 2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and other subsequent disclosure documents filed with the SEC. Gilead claims the protection of the Safe Harbor contained in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 for forward-looking statements. All forward-looking statements are based on information currently available to Gilead and Gilead assumes no obligation to update or supplement any such forward-looking statements other than as required by law. Any forward-looking statements speak only as of the date hereof or as of the dates indicated in the statements.</font></div><div Commissioner</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">, which requires related parties in an intercompany cost sharing arrangement to share expenses related to stock-based compensation</font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="17" style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;padding-left:24px;text-indent:-24px;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:6pt">(4)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The fourth quarter and full year 2019 included a deferred tax benefit related to intangible asset transfers from a foreign subsidiary to Ireland and the United States. /* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}

..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}

/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}

/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}

..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}

/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}

..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}

..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}

..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}

..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}

/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}

..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}

..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}

/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}

/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}

..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}

/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}

..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}

..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}

..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}

..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}

..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
</TEXT>

<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
